title: School For Scandal from the Greewich Theatre (2009)
description:
School For Scandal (2009)  Stage On Screen from The Greenwich Theatre, London
From the play by Richard Brinsley Sheridan (produced 1777.)
Production of dvd date approximate.

runtime 2 hrs 27 minutes

No IMDb reference

Summary from the website (partial)

"The School for Scandal was written by Richard Brinsley Sheridan, with a prologue by 
the famous actor David Garrick, and was first performed in 1777.

Itâ€™s the story of two brothers, one apparently a model citizen, the other a dissolute 
neâ€™er-do-well. But as the play progresses and the scandal-mongering backfires, the 
tables are turned on the siblings.  An enduring classic that still hits home today..."


Cast and Creatives

Directed for the stage by   Elizabeth Freestone
Directed for the screen by  Chris Cowey

Maria                   Joanna Christie
Mr. Snake               Guy Burgess
Lady Sneerwell          Amy Rockson
Lady Teazle             Beatrice Curnew
Sir Peter Teazle        Jonathan Bettersby
Sir Benjamin Backbite   Gareth Kennerley
Oliver Surface          Mark Extance
Charles Surface         Adam Redmore
Joseph Surface          Samuel Collings

Complete cast and creatives in the credit roll

My notes

  Though theatre is and should always be for everyone,  this production
shows how broad a production can be.  I'll give nothing away but the best referent I 
can give is the Globe Theatre production of Twelfth Night where Mark Rylance stars in 
an original practices version as Lady Olivia.


  This is the third of the Greenwich products I have in my fileshare collection.  As 
noted previously, they are teaching editions in their packaged form and have this 
unique feature:  A third disk contains a Master Shot of the whole production from 
above.  This allows for students to see how blocking is done and sets are changed.

  The interval simply goes dark with more black screen than is needed.  I have made 
the torrent in two parts.

  English subtitles are available for those who wish to follow the performance with 
text. Sheridan like Shakespeare produces dialog where the intricacy of the dialog 
make subtitles a convenient addition.  In VLC or other player, subs can be found in the player's menu top of screen.

  One note on Stage On Screen.  Please encourage them through their website
to make these dvd boxes of Volpone,  The Duchess of Malfi and School for Scandal
more readily available.

  This from the website:  "The School for Scandal is now available to purchase on DVD 
or as paid downloads on YouTube."  The service is new since I last checked.  But 
these plays are file shared for those who may not be in a position to use the services as paid clients.  Those who can, should.  You can find "Volpone" and "The Duchess of Malfi" under my login name.

Notes written  September 09, 2016
